sentences.en: A single act of rebellion or disobedience was often enough to seal a woman's fate.
sentences.cn: 仅一次反抗或不服从的行为在以前就往往足以决定一个女人的命运。

sentences.en: Answer or you may regret your disobedience.
sentences.cn: 回答,否则你们会为自己违抗命令后悔的.

sentences.en: At last she said, " well, sir, what excuse for this disobedience? "
sentences.cn: 终于,她说道: “ 好啦, 先生, 您怎么解释这种不听话的行为 呢 ? ”

sentences.en: Civil disobedience, violent or non-violent, is intentional law breaking.
sentences.cn: 公民抗命，不管是暴力还是非暴力的，都是故意犯法。

sentences.en: Disobedience cannot be allowed in the army.
Eg . Tom s disobedience to his old grandma made me red.
sentences.cn: 汤姆对他年迈的祖母不孝顺,简直令我火冒三丈.
他因不服从(命令)而受到了处分.

sentences.en: His behaviour was seen as another act of disobedience.
sentences.cn: 他的行为被看作又一次的违抗.

sentences.en: I shall overlook your disobedience this time.
sentences.cn: 这次,我不计较你不服从.

sentences.en: Ignorance does not excuse disobedience of the law.
sentences.cn: 无知不能成为不服法的理由.

sentences.en: She fetched a crack on the child's head for disobedience.
sentences.cn: 那孩子不听话,她啪地一声打在他的头上.

sentences.en: Such acts of disobedience vindicated the superiority of natural law.
sentences.cn: 为这种拒绝服从辩护的理由就是自然法至上原则.

sentences.en: The boy was beaten for disobedience.
sentences.cn: 这男孩因不听话挨了打.

sentences.en: The teacher said that he could not let your disobedience pass.
sentences.cn: 老师说他对于你的不服从不会放过.

sentences.en: They have been repelled by the apparent sophistry of parts of his essay on " Civil Disobedience ".
sentences.cn: 对他在 《 论公民的不服从》一文中某些显而易见的 诡辩,他们颇有反感.

sentences.en: This form of civil disobedience isn't a particularly new phenomenon.
sentences.cn: 这种形式的非暴力反抗并不是特别新的现象。

words.tran_cn: 不服从的；违背的；不孝的

phrases.tran_cn: 非暴力反抗，温和抵抗；不合作主义

trans.tran_cn: 不服从，不顺从，违抗，违反
trans.tran_en: Disobedience is deliberately not doing what someone tells you to do, or what a rule or law says that you should do
